subclusters.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Dietary Restriction Longevity Theory
Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IGF-1 and growth hormone signaling pathways regulating growth, metabolism, and lifespan, with evidence from genetic models showing lifespan extension via reduced IGF-1 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IGF-1’s role in bone quality and aging via glycation accumulation, linking IGF-1 signaling decline to age-related tissue fragility, fitting the IGF-1/GH signaling theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details IGF-1 as a conserved pacesetter of aging, with downregulation extending lifespan, consistent with the GH/IGF-1 signaling modulation mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on GH receptor exon 3 deletion affecting GH sensitivity and IGF-1 levels, influencing male-specific longevity, fitting the GH/IGF-1 signaling modulation cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores calorie restriction effects on IGF-1 signaling and cancer risk, emphasizing modulation of IGF-1 bioavailability and signaling in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits that suppression of the somatotropic (GH/IGF-1) axis extends lifespan by reducing metabolism and oxidative stress, fitting the GH/IGF-1 signaling modulation theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes GH signaling suppression as central to mammalian aging regulation, with genetic mutations reducing GH/IGF-1 signaling linked to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows GH deficiency extends lifespan across species, with metabolic reprogramming and growth-longevity tradeoffs, consistent with GH/IGF-1 signaling modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Ames dwarf mice with GH/IGF-1 deficiencies show extended lifespan, linking hormonal deficiency and reduced IGF-1 signaling to delayed aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Suppression of IGF-1 signaling in neural stem cells preserves neurogenesis and delays aging, fitting the IGF-1/GH signaling modulation cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/GH Signaling Modulation Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: mRNA decapping modulates neuronal insulin/IGF-like signaling affecting lifespan, linking post-transcriptional regulation to IGF-1 pathway and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Dietary Restriction Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on dietary restriction extending lifespan via insulin/IGF-1 and TOR pathways, emphasizing nutrient sensing and metabolic adaptation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Dietary Restriction Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes conserved nutrient-sensing pathways (IIS, mTOR) regulating aging and reproduction trade-offs, highlighting dietary restriction effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Dietary Restriction Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: SGLT inhibitors mimic nutrient deprivation signaling, activating AMPK, sirtuins, and autophagy, reducing mTOR signaling and oxidative stress, fitting nutrient-sensing theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Dietary Restriction Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: TOR signaling regulates growth, reproduction, and lifespan trade-offs; rapamycin downregulates TOR to extend lifespan, consistent with nutrient-sensing longevity mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Dietary Restriction Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Identifies conserved longevity pathways including sirtuins and nutrient-sensing kinases, with calorie restriction as a conserved intervention.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on longevity-assurance genes modulating lifespan via disease protection and metabolic homeostasis, emphasizing genetic control and gene-environment interactions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Molecular recognition systems control life cycle and aging via immune system regulation and genetic polymorphisms, fitting genetic control of longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Dauer formation pathway in C. elegans genetically controls aging and lifespan extension, illustrating genetic regulation of life-history and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed and altruistic aging theory posits evolved genetic programs promoting aging for group benefit, highlighting genetic and evolutionary control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed thymic involution is a conserved, genetically regulated aging process affecting immune aging, fitting genetic longevity control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Thymic involution as phenoptosis exemplifies programmed aging with genetic and oxidative stress components, consistent with genetic aging programs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed aging paradigm based on telomere shortening and cell turnover decline, emphasizing genetically regulated cellular aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Growth-limiting genetic program theory describes juvenile growth deceleration continuing into adulthood causing aging, highlighting genetic regulation of lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmatic aging theory based on gene expression trajectories and attractor states, proposing a genetically programmed aging path.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmatic features of aging originating in development describe persistent developmental genetic programs causing aging, emphasizing genetic and epigenetic regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed aging controlled by epigenetic clocks proposes aging as a genetically regulated process orchestrated by epigenetic timing mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Longevity Assurance and Life-History Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed aging as an evolutionarily selected genetic program highlights aging as an adaptive, genetically controlled process with evolutionary trade-offs.
